title.narrative: Syrien-Irak 2019-2021. UNDP-IMS Media and Elections in Iraq, engagement

description.narrative: The objective of the peace and stabilisation cooperation among the parties is increased media content that is independent, impartial, and inclusive on the 2021 Iraq elections, which serves to further democratic values, accountability, and positive social and political change.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

description.narrative: FL §06.32.08.80 Global Framework for Integrated Stabilisation Efforts (development assistance)

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity

Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation

description.narrative: 1.1.1 Number of journalists who have been trained online on professional election coverage according to international standards (disaggregated by age, gender and geographic distribution)(monitored by survey pre- and post-training) 1.1.2 Number of journalists who have been mentored by subject matter experts from online training workshops or partner CSOs. (monitored by survey pre- and post-training)

(monitored by survey pre- and post-training)

Number of factsheets or fact-checked statements made by power holders and related to the Iraqi elections produced and published on social media.
150-200 content pieces consisting of factsheets or fact-checked statements made by power holders in relation to the Iraqi elections published on social media. (Content will be monitored)

Number of factsheets or fact-checked statements made by power holders and related to the Iraqi elections produced and published on social media.
150-200 content pieces consisting of factsheets or fact-checked statements made by power holders in relation to the Iraqi elections published on social media. (Content will be monitored)
Number of journalists trained online on recognising and combating hate speech, and gender-sensitive reporting.(disaggregated by age, gender and geographic distribution)
Number of journalists trained online on recognising and combating hate speech, and gender-sensitive reporting.(disaggregated by age, gender and geographic distribution)

Number of journalists trained online on the production of inclusive media content. (disaggregated by age, gender and geographic distribution)
30-40 journalists have been trained online on the production of inclusive media content. (monitored by survey pre- and post-training)

Number of journalists who have been mentored by subject matter experts from online training workshops or partner CSOs. (monitored by survey pre- and post-training)
Number of journalists who have been mentored by subject matter experts from online training workshops or partner CSOs. (monitored by survey pre- and post-training)

Number of journalists who have been mentored by subject matter experts from training workshops or partner CSOs. (disaggregated b age, gender and geographic distribution)
At least 15-20 journalists have received one-to-one mentorship by trainers/experts. (monitored by survey pre- and post-training)

Number of journalists who have been mentored by subject matter experts from training workshops or partner CSOs. (disaggregated b age, gender and geographic distribution)
At least 15-20 journalists have received one-to-one mentorship by trainers/experts. (monitored by survey pre- and post-training)
Number of journalists who have been mentored by subject matter experts from training workshops or partner CSOs.
Number of journalists who have been mentored by subject matter experts from training workshops or partner CSOs.

Number of media monitor reports produced tracking the quality of content in relation to the elections and tracking the IHEC’s performance.
6-10 media monitoring reports produced by CSO’s/Iraqi academics tracking the quality of content produced in relation to the elections, and tracking the IHEC’s performance, with subsequent roundtable evaluation with editors and journalists. (Content will be monitored)

Number of media monitor reports produced tracking the quality of content in relation to the elections and tracking the IHEC’s performance.
6-10 media monitoring reports produced by CSO’s/Iraqi academics tracking the quality of content produced in relation to the elections, and tracking the IHEC’s performance, with subsequent roundtable evaluation with editors and journalists. (Content will be monitored)

Social media campaign publishing IHEC messaging and other voter education content developed.
One social media campaign developed (The media development NGO partner gathers IHEC messaging and develops a “Get out and vote” social media campaign promoting active and inclusive participation in the electoral process.) (Process will be monitored)

Social media campaign publishing IHEC messaging and other voter education content developed.
One social media campaign developed (The media development NGO partner gathers IHEC messaging and develops a “Get out and vote” social media campaign promoting active and inclusive participation in the electoral process.) (Process will be monitored)

• Proportion of online-trained journalists’ report that they feel better equipped to cover the elections. (monitored by survey pre- and post-training) • Proportion of online trained journalists who have produced and published content that demonstrate principles of inclusion. (content produced will be monitored) • Proportion of content authored by online-trained journalists with gender-inclusive language. (content produced will be monitored) • Proportion of fact-checked statements related to the Iraqi elections that counters misinformation or disinformation.(content produced will be monitored) • Number of media outlets publishing IHEC messaging and voter education content as part of social media campaign. (content produced will be monitored)
